fields.description:
1 Select the 'Issues' tab, and then from the 'GreenHopper' section, select 'Project Templates'.
2 In the 'Project Templates' screen, from the 'Create a new project' dropdown list, select 'Scrum'.
3 As shown by the attachment, after I clicked "Change Colour" button on a "project template", the drop-down wouldn't go away when I clicked other controls.
4 In order for it to disappear, I had to click the "Change Colour" button again or select a colour in that colour drop-down. This behaviour only happens to the change colour drop-downs and all the others work fine. I suspect it has something to do with the multi-tab display of this drop down?
fields.summary: Change Colour drop-down wouldn't go away

fields.description:

I would like to get a notification when an issue has been moved. But I want the notification for the source project not for the target project.
How can this be done?
Thanks & kind regards,
Thomas

fields.description:
Now that we've switched to a new version numbering scheme, the version number in the footer is confusing people. It's kind of meaningless in a SaaS product, anyway.

This may still be useful for dev, QA, and support purposes, so it should continue to be included in an HTML comment so that you can see it by viewing the page source.
fields.summary: Hide the Studio version from the footer

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
* Login to Studio
* Logout using the top-right menu. You should end up on a page like: http://dev.jira.com/secure/StudioLogout!default.jspa
* *From this page*, attempt to login using the top-right link.
* After entering your credentials, you are immediately redirected back to the logout page. You are therefore logged out before you can take any action.
fields.summary: Can't login using the top-right login link immediately after logging out.

fields.description:
Currently the upgrade link in the licensing page points to:

Which is not the best link to point users to for Studio. When Studio integrates with HAL for licensing, it would be best to pull the link from HAL when HAL provides Studio with the licensing configuration:

https://studio.atlassian.com/wiki/display/JST/HAL+JIRA+Studio+Licensing+Spec

After resetting it to have the default look and feel the URL looks like: {{/download/resources/com.atlassian.studio.static:studio_images/images/StudioLogo.png}}.

Studio instances provisioned after the upgrade have working logos.

fields.description:
When the Application status for confluence is changed different parts of the application need to be notified about the change so that some task can be performed.
Implement an AppStatusEvent that can be published by the AppStatusService.
fields.summary: Create a AppStatusChange Event that confluence can fire to notify listeners when the app status changes

fields.description:
JVM parameters are stored in various files within {{/service/j2ee_instance.jirastudio.com-$app/env/}}. There are specific files for commonly overridden options (e.g. {{MAX_HEAP}}). To override the file, you copy it to {{/data/jirastudio/service/$app/user_env/}} and make your changes to it there.

Sometimes additional JVM parameters need to be added. There's no obvious way to add arbitrary JVM options so what ends up happening is that {{JAVA_OPTS}} will be overridden by a Support Engineer with the new params. Unfortunately when new params are added to the original {{JAVA_OPTS}} file by developers that are needed as part of an upgrade they will never see the light of day, since the original file is still being overridden by the stale {{JAVA_OPTS}} created by the Supporter.

We need a system where the original JAVA_OPTS file is not overridden and can be safely modified by developers, but that allows for (arbitrary or commonly used) JVM params to be set by Supporters
fields.summary: Provide a safe method to add JVM parameters

fields.description:
We've seen at least one occurrence of the SetupBamboo project creation syncing executing at the same time as the func tests were trying to create a project, which resulted in a build breakage:

https://bamboo.extranet.atlassian.com/browse/JST-NONGAPPS-309

We should implement something to ensure that the project sync either doesn't execute during the func tests, or has finished executing before the func tests run.
fields.summary: Ensure SetupBamboo project creation doesn't interfere with func tests

fields.description:
Since upgrading to Firefox 4, I get weird scrolling behaviour when using code reviews on Studio. This doesn't happen with AtlasEye, so perhaps it has been fixed in a more recent version of Crucible.


See the attached screenshot for what happens after I scroll a bit on a file. The review content is basically unreadable.
fields.summary: Code review scrolling is glitchy in Firefox 4, makes reviews unreadable
Confluence does not always start up successfully on Studio JIRA 4.3 branch

fields.description:
We currently use Google Apps and JIRA with application windows in Chrome (direct links on desktop). Right now, even after some minutes (15?) of being logged in or closing the window, we need to log in with google again.

I would be great if we could remain logged in as long as we remain logged into Google Apps (using the "remember me" checkbox)...
fields.summary: As a google apps user, I want to remain logged into JIRA as long as I am logged in into google apps.

fields.description:
We will be shipping studio versions with 'a la carte' features before summit, and we therefore need a way to make these features dark.

I suggest providing a configuration option on the 'App Status Admin' page (jira/secure/admin/EditAppStatus.jspa), which is accessible only to system administrators.

For this iteration, the places in the code that will rely on this switch (I'm sure there will be more) are:
  * Add project page (should display checkboxes with options for what components to create if and only if 'a la carte' is enabled)
  * Footer (switch between Studio and On Demand footer)
  * Intro Gadget (switch between Studio and On Demand intro gadget)
  * Any new pages related to a la carte functionality:   
     - Confluence theme configuration pages
     - Project component bulk add page
fields.summary: As a Jira Studio system administrator, I would like to be able to make 'A la Carte' a dark feature
Implement 'On Demand' sysadmin screen for testing enable/disable of individual applications
Get Studio compiling against 4.4
Update POM to use JIRA4.4-Snapshot
Create branch for integration work

fields.description:
Let's say we have a project with a confluence space, and the customer decides to disable confluence on their instance. When confluence is disabled, the application needs to scan through all projects and delete any project links to confluence spaces.

The confluence space, and the data it contains itself shouldn't be deleted, so it will be possible to relink the space to a project if confluence is re-enabled.
fields.summary: As a JIRA Studio user, I only want to see references to enabled applications
As a Jira Studio user, I should see a friendly error page when I try to access a URL for an application that is not enabled

fields.description: e.g., I should not see the 'Wiki' tab if this project doesn't have a linked Confluence space, even if Confluence is enabled
fields.summary: When I am browsing a project as a JIRA Studio User, I only want to see the application tabs relevant for this project
As a Jira On Demand system administrator, I would like to be able to enable and disable applications through the studio admin user interface
Move StudioJIRAAuthenticator in its own package

fields.description: Begin early integration of JIRA 4.4 with Studio.  This issue is also tracked in [JRA-24224 | http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-24224].
fields.summary: Integrate JIRA 4.4 with Studio

fields.description:
The global search feature makes searching Jira issues (which is what I do most of the time, and 100% of the time when I'm in the Issues section) much more tedious because it breaks Jira's "smart search" feature, and an extra click is required to get a tabular issue list.

Should be simple to add an option to disable the global search feature (and revert to using the search of each product, depending on the active section), for people who aren't getting any value out of the global search feature?
fields.summary: Option to the disable the global search feature

fields.description:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASTUDIO/Supported+Platforms is a little out of date. https://studio.atlassian.com/wiki/display/JST/Browser+Support+Matrix has the definitive list of supported browser versions for 2.4.1 and the April release. The list does not change for the April release, so it can be updated now and won't have to be changed until May.

In particular, IE6 is no longer supported.
fields.summary: Update supported browsers

fields.description: Current TestActivityStream is pretty flaky, it uses a huge regex to match the streams gadget src url. If any of the parameters in the url changes, or if the locale of the build agent is different, it would fail.
fields.summary: Flaky test: Make TestActivityStream less sensitive to Stream upgrade and locale

fields.description:
This affects the gdata macros in confluence and attaching Google docs to Issues, resulting in a message like "An error was encountered while retrieving documents."
The problem appears to be double URL-encoding of the domain. From the single signer log:

{noformat}
WARN : Invalid signing request: No domain was specified in the request
DEBUG: Request was 'GET&https%3A%2F%2Fdocs.google.com%2Ffeeds%2Fdefault%2Fprivate%2Ffull&oauth_consumer_key%3Dclover.atlassian.com%26oauth_nonce%3D1820870181423915%26oauth_signature_method%3DHMAC-SHA1%26oauth_timestamp%3D1301389017%26xoauth_requestor_id%3Ddev%2540atl-paid-dev.com'
{noformat}

Note the double URL-encoding of {{@}} (%40) {{xoauth_requestor_id%3Ddev%2540atl-paid-dev.com}}. Double encoding may actually be correct here, but I think the signer is only expecting that part to be encoded once.
fields.summary: Accessing Google docs from GApps fails on Unicorn

fields.description: After 101.2 has been deployed to {{test}}, {{stage}}, and {{googletest}} as requested by [AOD-633|https://collab.contegix.com/browse/AOD-633], we noticed that the Studio logo is missing on {{stage}} and {{googletest}}. Sam suggested that it was because an upgrade task ({{UT053UpgradeStudioLogoToPng}}) might have failed to change the logo to the new PNG image on these 2 instances.
fields.summary: Studio logo missing for some instances after deploying 101.2 (April Release candidate)

!View_Issue_Build_Tab_1301462361202.png!

fields.description:
We currently don't have any automated tests that can test an elastic bamboo build, because elastic agents cannot access our SVN repository when developing locally or in CI.

Elastic bamboo builds need to be tested manually on a server that elastic agents can see.
fields.summary: Test elastic bamboo builds

fields.description:
{{AppLinksSvnRepository.addDefaultValues(BuildConfiguration)}} used to use a hack to get a reference to the project that the build currently being created belongs to, in order to populate the repository path with {{/<project key>/trunk}}. This was possible because bamboo used a wizard to create the plan; the first step being to choose a project, and the project was stored in the session.

This is no longer possible because the form to create a plan is all on the same page.

Find a nice way to keep this functionality.
fields.summary: Fix repository path default value population

fields.description:
Currently, if a component or action requires filtered CrowdService, Spring will throw an exception because it finds two beans implementing that interface. So we have a workaround to inject the UnfilteredCrowdService instead, but that defeats the purpose of filtered CrowdService.

Workaround has been applied to two classes:
* LegacyStudioImportManager
* StudioEditProfile
fields.summary: Inject CrowdService instead of UnfilteredCrowdService for normal usage
